memory_entry.title: Documentation Directory Cleanup - Cognitive Load Reduction
memory_entry.summary: Successfully cleaned up docs/ directory by moving 32 documents to organized archive structure, reducing cognitive load while preserving historical access
key_insights: 12 comprehensive guides created overwhelming cognitive load for users
Version-specific documents caused confusion about which version to follow
Essential information was fragmented across multiple comprehensive guides
Four-category archive structure (comprehensive-guides, version-specific, analysis-reports, epic-documents) provides effective organization
Git history preservation through 'git mv' commands is essential for archival process
workflow_improvements: Archive strategy: Move historical/reference content to organized archive with comprehensive READMEs
Category organization: Group archived content by purpose/type for better discoverability
Documentation priority: Focus main directory on essential, daily-use documentation only
Navigation simplification: Reduce top-level document count while maintaining complete access to information
user_feedback_patterns: Cognitive overload from too many comprehensive guides in main directory
Difficulty finding specific information quickly due to document proliferation
Confusion between current and historical documentation
Need for clear navigation pathways based on user type (new users, developers, administrators)
technical_solutions: Created four-category archive structure with detailed README files
Maintained git history through proper git mv commands for tracked files
Used regular mv for untracked files (EP-0041 series)
Created comprehensive archive documentation explaining movement rationale
Updated main README.md to focus on current framework usage and navigation
metrics_achieved: 90% reduction in top-level document count (29 â†’ 3 core + 8 directories)
100% preservation of historical content with improved organization
Clear user journey pathways for different user types
next_actions_required: Update INDEX.md to fix broken links and reflect new structure
Promote user-guide/ as primary user documentation
Monitor archive access patterns to optimize organization
reusable_patterns: Archive-first approach: Move non-essential content to well-documented archive rather than deletion
Category-based organization: Group similar archived content with descriptive README files
Git history preservation: Always use git mv for tracked files during reorganization
Comprehensive documentation: Create detailed explanations for why content was moved and when to reference it
